name: Nuno Salvador
overview: Senior iOS developer with 10+ years of commercial startup/agency experience on the field. Over these years I’ve been exposed to several projects with distinct varieties that taught me how to create eye appealing mobile applications while maintaining a clean architecture with enough flexibility to easily allow addition of new features and interact very quickly around them. Worked with a diversity of personalities, customers and end-users and have played a key role in all the projects I’ve been involved, providing vital input to project planning, UX/UI discussions, indoctrinate good software development practices and encourage the use of continuous delivery within my team. Clean core values, processes and team collaboration are the main ingredients to ensure a high standard process, top tier architecture and elegant applications.

workExperience.jobDescription: App with all the news and info for the league, video highlights, match schedules, ladder breakdown, team and player stats and live scores information.

workExperience.companyName: Hayya Card for FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022
workExperience.jobDescription: Other than having all the information regarding the event, the app was meant to be used by the attendees/staff as an id card to enter the closed area where the event was occurring and to be able to access the available services (food/drinks, booking taxis, access public transport schedules, etc) all around the cities.

The Commonwealth Games is a quadrennial international multi-sport event among athletes from the Commonwealth of Nations, which mostly consists of territories of the former British Empire. In 2022 it was hosted in Birmingham.
iOS app to allow a user to buy/offer a voucher and book one of the activities included on it (remotely with team in Dublin)
Worked on three different projects for Vodafone. (maintenance, chatbot, iot sdk)
Worked on multi-platform Dating App with millions of users around the globe.

Initially the App was develop by a outsourcing company and because the app was relatively new and there was no in-house iOS developers, there was no development process whatsoever on the iOS side. QA team had no way to test the app unless they made a build themselves on their laptop or ask for a compiled build on their device and UI elements were discussed and being sent by Slack. Used my expertise to establish a iOS development process and encourage a cross functional collaboration from all the teams in order to create a better product.

Joined a digital agency and worked with Management, design and QA team members to deliver apps that people wants to talk about. Worked for multiple client projects of diverse size/complexity and took charge of internal projects to improve/create reusable frameworks for accelerating initial app builds. Also contributed to improve our Kanban and Agile process as well on our developer, design and QA teams connection and inducting new starters.
